articles.title: U.S. Reckless Provocations Are Bound to Be Foiled
Friendly Meetings Held in Syria and Iran
DPRK's Stand on Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Friendly Meetings Held in Syria and Iran 
   Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Friendly meetings were held in Damascus Rural Province in Syria and on the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm on June 15 and 16 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The director for Workers and Farmers of the Damascus Rural Provincial Committee of Syria's Arab Socialist Baath Party said in his speech that the Syrian party and people are following with keen interest the friendly Korean people advancing at the head of the world independent forces in the struggle against the U.S. imperialists' domination, single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Il.    
 The manager of the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm in his speech wished the friendly Korean people great success in their work for national reunification and the prosperity of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il and sincerely hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between Iran and the DPRK would grow stronger.

articles.title: June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Stand on Reunification Supported 
   Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Paul Kagame, president of Rwanda, supported the stand of the DPRK to achieve the reunification of the country by concerted efforts of the Korean nation when receiving credentials from Pak Hyon Jae, DPRK ambassador to his country, on June 12.
 He said that the two countries have long maintained good relations and his government is rejoiced over the great successes made by the Korean people in all fields under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: All-People Rally against Expansion of U.S. Military Base in S. Korea
Imperialists' Ideological and Cultural Poisoning Denounced
articles.content:
All-People Rally against Expansion of U.S. Military Base in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The third all-people rally for checking the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek was reportedly held in Taechu-ri, south Korea, on June 18 under the sponsorship of the All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek.
 Speakers at the rally said that the struggle of peasants to check the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek and guarantee their peaceful farming activities is just and the authorities' suppression of it cannot be pardoned.    
 On the same day a candle-light rally against the expansion of the U.S. military base took place in Phyongthaek City, Kyonggi Province. It was attended by at least 1,500 members of civic organizations and residents in Taechu-ri and Todu-ri.
